item.description:
TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW!  Email me directly (jmmoran@nycap.rr.com) with any questions!  - Julie.

Difficulty: About 8.5 Miles, about 3,520 Feet Elevation Change; at just under one mile per hour (bushwhack speed), this is about an 9.5-hour hike.  

 

Car Spot Meetup Time,  White Mountain (National Forest) Attractions Center: 8 a.m.

Trailhead Start Time: 8:15 a.m.

LINK TO GOOGLE MAPS (CLICK HERE) -- Estimated Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the meetup location to the parking area for the Octagon Lodge, Four-Passenger Gondola and the trail system to the Summit Lodge (open 9:30 a.m. - 4 p.m.), Loon Mountain, North Peak and the start of the "herd Path" into the woods towards the Scar Ridge west and east peaks!  The main bridge has washed out to the parking lot; we'll follow the detour route to the resort base lodge.


Essentials To Bring: Flash light / head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items, bug spray, sun screen, cell phone, camera.  CHECK ALL YOUR GEAR, ESPECIALLY YOUR ELECTRONICS AND (SPARE) BATTERIES!!!  Bring a good jacket to block winds and tight brush; consider eye protection!  Expect low winds this weekend but temps dipping toward the low 50's toward the summit.

 

EVENT ORGANIZER: 

Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT). You can send text messages to me as well.


NARRATIVE AND UPDATES (09-07-2011 8 pm):  Downpours, floods, floods and carnage ... tragedy in the mountains ... and yet ...

... ARE YOU READY TO FACE THE ENEMY?!?

 

This required-New England Hundred Highest-required summit is a pure bushwhack; many have said it was their worst 'whack experience.  But ... you are ready to get back into raw, rough mountaineering ecstasy!  Depending on our skill in navigating, some TRs show this as not so rough ... we'll do much of our ascent on ski trails, then cut left and attack the scruffy White Mountain balsam brush to work our way across the west to east peaks of Scar Ridge, returning the same way.

The following day I will be leading a bushwhack hike to Elephant Mountain, weather permitting ... and so far the weekend weather looks great!


NOTE:  Great weather is (finally!) predicted ... however, if weather reports change to unfavorable, I WILL RESCHEDULE. Also, all my hikes are dog friendly (and Mike will be coming!) -- if you don't like dogs, don't come.

 

A neat old postcard view ...
